modules.description: This module enables multi-shot continuation manipulation by converting and invoking shallow continuations. It provides operations to promote, resume, and abort shallow resumptions, as well as clone and drop shallow continuations. Use cases include implementing advanced control flow mechanisms like coroutines, backtracking, or exception handling with precise context reinstatement.

This module enables multi-shot continuation handling by converting and managing deep continuations. It provides operations to promote, resume, and abort continuations, as well as clone or drop them explicitly. Use cases include implementing advanced control flow mechanisms like coroutines, backtracking, or exception handling with precise backtrace support.

This module extends OCaml's linear continuations with multi-shot capabilities, supporting both shallow and deep continuation manipulation. It offers data types representing resumable continuation states, with operations to promote, resume, abort, clone, and drop continuations. These features enable advanced control flow patterns such as coroutines, backtracking search, and context-aware exception handling with precise control over execution reinstatement. For example, a coroutine system can be built by cloning and resuming continuations at different points in the program's execution.
